physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At age 11 years, Patient 1 showed marked bowing and hyperostosis in long bones, severe bilateral coxa vara with a 80° angle, a shortened right leg with 5 cm difference in length, and joint contractures with limitations of movement in both elbows (160°) and left knee.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, the patient experienced pain and developmental delays but showed improvement in motor development and pain reduction after pamidronate treatment. Joint contractures developed over time.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At age 3 years, Patient 2 presented with non-progressive mild bowing of both femurs and coxa vara on the left side.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient showed developmental improvement in gross motor function with pamidronate treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At age 3 years, Patient 3 had failure to thrive, osteopenic bones, and developmental delays.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After starting treatment with intravenous Zoledronate, the patient showed progressive improvement in gross motor skills and less sweating.
